There is no ¥ in ASCII!

**¥** is the symbol for Japanese yen, analogous to [$](/wiki/$ "$") for the dollar or the [zorkmid](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") of *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The character is not part of [ASCII](/wiki/ASCII "ASCII"), and requires Unicode or another character set that supports it to be displayed; it does not appear in most [curses interface](/wiki/Curses_interface "Curses interface") library software, such as the typical [tty](/wiki/Tty "Tty")-[Unix](/wiki/Unix "Unix") game).

## Dudley's dungeon

While no [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster"), [item](/wiki/Item "Item") or other [square](/wiki/Square "Square") in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* appears onscreen as a ¥, [Dudley's dungeon](/wiki/Dudley%27s_dungeon "Dudley's dungeon") has put the symbol to some use:

- [22 September 2005](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20050922): A [marilith](/wiki/Marilith "Marilith") that is killed drops a ¥-shirt, rather than a [T-shirt](/wiki/T-shirt "T-shirt") (which would not fit a marilith's six arms).
- [27 June 2006](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20060627): The ¥ represents a "nonexistent" monster that is among the failed candidates for [Dudley](/wiki/Dudley "Dudley")'s sidekick.
- [30 November 2006](http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20061130): Dudley has an 'imagine spot' involving methods to improve [Vlad the Impaler](/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler "Vlad the Impaler"); one such idea is "Vlad the impossible", represented by a ¥.
- [2009 August 26](https://web.archive.org/web/20180628091852/http://sadowl.com/dudley/index.php?f=20090826) (sadowl): Dudley finds yen rather than gold in a vault while playing as a [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai").

[![This article is unlikely to require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/58/Noversion.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article is unlikely to require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
¥

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt
There is no ¥ in ASCII!

¥ is the symbol for Japanese yen, analogous to $ for the dollar or the zorkmid of NetHack. The character is not part of ASCII, and requires Unicode or another character set that supports it to be displayed; it does not appear in most curses interface library software, such as the typical tty-Unix game).

Dudley's dungeon

While no monster, item or other square in NetHack appears onscreen as a ¥, Dudley's dungeon has put the symbol to some use:

  • 22 September 2005: A marilith that is killed drops a ¥-shirt, rather than a T-shirt (which would not fit a marilith's six arms).
  • 27 June 2006: The ¥ represents a "nonexistent" monster that is among the failed candidates for Dudley's sidekick.
  • 30 November 2006: Dudley has an 'imagine spot' involving methods to improve Vlad the Impaler; one such idea is "Vlad the impossible", represented by a ¥.
  • 2009 August 26 (sadowl): Dudley finds yen rather than gold in a vault while playing as a Samurai.
Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=¥&oldid=160176"

There is no ¥ in ASCII!
'''¥''' is the symbol for Japanese yen, analogous to [[$]] for the dollar or the [[zorkmid]] of ''[[NetHack]]''. The character is not part of [[ASCII]], and requires Unicode or another character set that supports it to be displayed; it does not appear in most [[curses interface]] library software, such as the typical [[tty]]-[[Unix]] game). ==Dudley's dungeon== While no [[monster]], [[item]] or other [[square]] in ''[[NetHack]]'' appears onscreen as a {{lightgray|¥}}, [[Dudley's dungeon]] has put the symbol to some use: * [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20050922 22 September 2005]: A [[marilith]] that is killed drops a ¥-shirt, rather than a [[T-shirt]] (which would not fit a marilith's six arms). * [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20060627 27 June 2006]: The ¥ represents a "nonexistent" monster that is among the failed candidates for [[Dudley]]'s sidekick. * [http://www.nicolaas.net/dudley/index.php?f=20061130 30 November 2006]: Dudley has an 'imagine spot' involving methods to improve [[Vlad the Impaler]]; one such idea is "Vlad the impossible", represented by a {{white|¥}}. * [https://web.archive.org/web/20180628091852/http://sadowl.com/dudley/index.php?f=20090826 2009 August 26] (sadowl): Dudley finds yen rather than gold in a vault while playing as a [[Samurai]]. {{noversion}} [[Category:Dudley's dungeon]]
